body.name: Similac NeoSure Premature Post-Discharge Infant Formula, Ready-to-Feed Baby Formula, 32-fl-oz Bottle
features: #1 PREMATURE INFANT FORMULA BRAND: And the #1 brand fed in the NICU
EXCELLENT CATCH-UP GROWTH: Supports better gains in weight, length, and head circumference for premature babies when compared to term infant formula
SUPPORTS BRAIN & EYE DEVELOPMENT: Has our unique blend of DHA, lutein, & vitamin E to support brain and eye development
HELPS SUPPORT BONE GROWTH: Our formula has calcium and phosphorus for baby’s growing bones
NO ARTIFICIAL GROWTH HORMONES: The first leading infant formula brand with no artificial growth hormones
body.description: Similac NeoSure* premature post-discharge baby formula promotes excellent catch-up growth1 during a premature baby’s first 12 months of life. It has enriched nutrition—with increased protein, vitamins, minerals, and increased calories for growth compared to term infant formula—as well as calcium and phosphorus for baby’s growing bones. It has DHA, lutein, and vitamin E to support baby’s brain and eye development, and it has no artificial growth hormones.‡ * Not for infants or children with galactosemia. † Total US premature infant formula, all outlets as of 12/2021 Nielsen data. ‡ No significant difference has been shown between milk derived from rbST-treated and non-rbST-treated cows. Reference: 1. Carver JD, et al. Pediatrics. 2001;107(4):683-689.

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #91,560 in Baby (See Top 100 in Baby) #164 in Powder Baby Formula

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: More to Consider Than Height and Weight Your baby’s doctor will track your preemie’s height, weight, and head size to be sure your baby is getting the nutrition they need to catch up on growth during their first year. These are important indicators of baby’s progress that you can see and measure. However, your preemie is catching up in ways you can’t see and measure. Catching Up on the Inside, Too Even after your baby has caught up on the outside, Similac NeoSure continues to deliver beneficial nutrients that support growth and development you can’t see—such as for internal organs, muscles, bones, and the brain. That’s why it’s important to continue to feed a nutrient-enriched formula like NeoSure until baby’s first birthday. Enriched Nutrition for a Preemie’s First Year Similac NeoSure supports better rates of growth during a premature baby’s first year compared to term infant formula.1 It has increased protein, vitamins, and minerals compared to term infant formula, and nucleotides for the developing immune system. Reference: 1. Carver JD, et al. Pediatrics. 2001;107(4):683-689.

Supports Brain & Eye Development Similac NeoSure has our exclusive blend of DHA for brain nourishment, lutein for eye health, and vitamin E for growth and development—all important nutrients naturally found in breast milk. No Palm Olein Oil Formulas with no palm olein oil have been shown to promote softer stools for babies, more like breastfed infants. And our no-palm-olein-oil blend supports excellent calcium absorption. Feeding Resources No matter how you choose to feed your baby, Similac is here to support your journey. The Similac Feeding Expert team can provide nutrition support and feeding advice when you need it. MySimilac Rewards With MySimilac Rewards, get nutrition guidance for you and baby, exclusive benefits, coupons, and much more.

Similac NeoSure* Similac Pro-Total Comfort* Similac 360 Total Care Sensitive* Similac Alimentum Enriched Nutrition** for Babies Born Prematurely ✓ Complete Nutrition for Infants ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Has DHA, Lutein, and Vitamin E ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Has 2'-FL HMO for Immune Support ✓ ✓ ✓ 5-HMO Prebiotic Blend Including 2'-FL HMO ✓ For Fussiness & Gas Due to Lactose Sensitivity ✓ ✓ Partially Hydrolyzed Whey Protein for Easy Digestion ✓ Hypoallergenic for Cow's Milk Allergy ✓ *Not for infants or children with galactosemia ✓ ✓ ✓ **Increased protein, vitamins, and minerals, compared to term formula ✓

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Weighed 1 Lb. 11 oz. when born. At 5 weeks baby's doctor started her on Similac Neosure and one year later baby weighs 21 lbs, 7 oz. and is super active. Finding a replacement for Similac is a daily ordeal and often futile but it is an excellent product. for our child.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good formula for premature babies.
reviews.reviewText: The hospital and my granddaughter's pediatrician both recommended this formula. My granddaughter was born prematurely at 30 weeks and could not feed herself or breathe on her own. Born weighing 3 pounds, she now weighs over 8 pounds at two and a half months since birth. She's had no problems with this formula. (She didn't like the powdered version.) I'd say it's a good product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth it for a premie.
reviews.reviewText: I had quadruplets born at 29weeks this formula has been great to catch them up in there weight. Baby A is the only one of my kids who still takes this formula due to GI reasons for the others and the bump in calories for her is exactly what she needs considering she started life at 2lbs and now weighs almost 12lbs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works well! Cheaper than stores
reviews.reviewText: Can’t speak for flavor lol I never tried it but baby eats it well. She was a preemie and it’s a little cheaper on amazon than the store to purchase these.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good for your Premie Baby.
reviews.reviewText: If you have a premature baby its good for them to get all the vitamins they need, only bad is milk has a smell to it as well baby poops are smelly, guess its due to the vitamins needed for your babies growth. Overall I recommend it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2020
reviews.reviewText: Just like in store without the trip.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2017
reviews.reviewText: Recommended by our doctor to help our premature baby put on weight. It worked extremely well- the extra calories really help out.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2019
